header.title: Brexit LIVE: EU prepares for Boris election victory - Secret trade talks already underway
header.subtitle: BRUSSELS is preparing for a Boris Johnson election victory with the European Commission stressing preparations are currently at technical level despite Brexit preparatory contracts being drawn up.
header.postText: 'The EU revealed they are pushing ahead with preparatory contacts at working level regardless of Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn’s threats to stop Brexit should he win the upcoming general election on December 12.',' The commission added contacts drawn up are being done so on a technical level because we do not know who will be the future leadership after the UK elections.', 'The comments come after Boris Johnson 's Conservative Party saw its lead over the opposition Labour Party narrow during the last week, an opinion poll by ICM for Reuters showed on Monday, ahead of the major ballot.', 'Support for the Conservatives fell one point to 41 percent, while the Labour Party was up two points on 34 percent.', '9.20 pm update: Heseltine tells lifelong Tory voters to back Lib Dems ', 'Lord Heseltine has told Britons to back to Lib Dems to stop Brexit.', 'The 86 - year - old grandee told the public to put the country first in a shocking appeal, The Mirror reports.', 'Lord Heseltine, when asked what advice he would give voters, said: I'm telling them to vote for what they believe and what the Conservative Party has stood for all my life and certainly all of theirs - and to put country first.', 'And what I think that means in practical terms is they either vote for the defrocked Conservative candidates, of which we have three excellent examples here, or they vote Lib Dem. ', '8.50pm update: Dominic Cummings claims Boris Johnson will crush Labour in Brexit election.', 'Dominic Cummings delivered a stunning response when confronted by stop Brexit campaigner Steve Bray earlier today, as he insisted the Tories will storm the general election and deliver Britain’s exit from the EU.', 'The Brexit mastermind was tracked down in London by Mr Bray who is known for his bellowing stop Brexit chant outside the Houses of Parliament.', 'Boris Johnson’s senior advisor told Mr Bray the Tories would win a majority at the election in 17 days time and finally get out of the European Union.', 'Mr Cummings, dressed-down in a tracksuit, green jacket and winter bobble hat, was followed by Mr Bray down the streets of the capital and challenged on the Tories election strategy.', '7pm update: Channel 4 threatens to empty chair PM in new debate', 'The Prime Minister could be empty - chaired during a televised climate change debate on Thursday.', 'Boris Johnson and Brexit Party leader Nigel Farage have yet to respond to a request to attend the hour-long Emergency On Planet Earth debate on Channel 4 News, which will focus solely on climate change.', 'The broadcaster said the debate will take place even if they are unable to take up the invitation.', 'Channel 4 has invited seven party leaders to the discussion, but so far only Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn, Scottish First Minister and SNP leader Nicola Sturgeon, Liberal Democrat leader Jo Swinson and Green co-leader Sian Berry have accepted the invitation.', '6.10pm update: Labour candidate red-faced after posts emerge of him hailing tory Boris a legend', 'A Labour Party candidate has been left red-faced after a Twitter post of him gushing over Boris Johnson was unearthed that saw him hail the Tory Party leader a legend.', 'James Wilder, 25, is standing is the safe Conservative seat of Newbury, Berkshire, and was praising Mr Johnson, the then-Tory Mayor of London, in a series of Twitter posts that also saw the would-be MP suggest he would want him to be his father.', 'The post was in relation to the 2012 Olympics held in London.', 'It read: Boris Johnson is a legend dancing to the Spice Girls!!'Great closing ceremony! Great Olympics!!', 'Another glowing post from Mr Wilder popped up in 2014 during the Invictus Games.', 'He shared a snap on Facebook with the comment: Boris giving me and Jono Spencer a wave.What a man.', 'A friend commented: Probably thought you were his long lost son Wilder.', 'Mr Wilder replied: I’ll take that Bearpark. The man's a legend!', 'The embarrassing posts have resurfaced as Mr Wilder knocks on doors to attempt to gain enough support before the general election on December 12.', 'West Berkshire Tory Association tweeted: We agree with Labour candidate James Wilder, Boris Johnson is a legend!!', 'Mr Wilder attempted to downplay the comments in a recent post, insisting he was a schoolboy at the time - despite the more recent of the posts being uploaded a mere five years ago.', 'He said: While the Conservatives with no forward thinking policies of their own are focusing on what a schoolboy said 10 years ago, my campaign is focusing on the positive policies to transform West Berkshire.', 'In 2016, two years after the second post about Mr Johnson, Mr Wilder uploaded a selfie with the Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn.', 'He captioned it: Me and my boy JC.', '5.23pm update: Pound gains as Conservative vote lead promises end to political uncertainty', 'Sterling climbed from recent lows as polls continued to show the ruling Conservatives as runaway favourites to win the December 12 election with a pledge to implement Brexit and halt 3-1/2 years of political uncertainty.', 'However, a recent poll showing the Conservatives lead over the main opposition Labour Party narrowing during the last week kept the pound under $1.29.', 'The pound was last up by 0.4 percent at $1.2883, having risen earlier to $1.2913, edging up further from the 10-day lows it hit on Friday when dire Purchasing Managers Index(PMI) data highlighted the weak state of the UK economy and underscored the low possibility of interest rate hikes in the near future.' , '4.42pm update: Last-minute surge of voter registrations expected ahead of Thursday’s deadline', 'There is less than 36 hours left to register to vote in the General Election', 'A last-minute surge in people registering to vote is expected ahead of the deadline on Tuesday night.', 'Nearly three million people have applied to register to vote in the past month, according to Government figures. Applications can be submitted until 11.59pm on November 26.', '4.32pm update: Boris Johnson announces ‘tide of investment’ post-Brexit.', 'Boris Johnson announced a post-Brexit tide of investment at a speech in Wales today.', 'The Prime Minister said: When we get Brexit done, believe me we will unleash a tide of investment into this country.', 'He said the Conservatives were the only party with a deal which was ready to go.', 'He got a laugh from the crowd when he referenced the Welsh word for microwave, saying: Just pop it in the popty ping, as we say in Wales, and it 's there. We could be out by January.', 'He set out some transport investments for the country, including upgrading the A55, and said the Brynglas tunnels on the M4 were like the nostrils of a Welsh dragon but were currently blocked.', 'He said: We are going to apply the Vicks inhaler.', '4pm update: EU stars removed from British disabled drivers’ blue badges', 'Boris Johnson’s Government has removed the EU stars from UK disabled blue badges in the latest move towards sovereignty.', 'The Guardian reports that the move comes after the decision to remove the words ‘European Union’ from British passports.', '3.45pm update: BBC admits ‘mistake’ made in Boris Johnson debate clip edit', 'The BBC has admitted it made a mistake following accusations that a Question Time clip was cut in a way which edited out laughter directed at the Prime Minister.', 'The broadcaster said it had cut a clip of Boris Johnson on the BBC's Question Time leaders' special on Friday November 22 for a shorter package to be shown on Saturday's lunchtime bulletin.', 'In a statement, the BBC accepted that the clip didn't reflect the full reaction to Boris Johnson 's answer.', 'The full clip, which includes audible laughter, was shown in full on the BBC's flagship News At 10 programme on the Friday evening.', 'However, thousands of people have shared a video of the shorter clip on social media, in which no laughter can be heard.', 'The BBC said there was absolutely no intention to mislead.', '3.20pm update: Chuka Umunna says PM aligned with right wing authoritarian nationalists', 'Leading Liberal Democrat Chuka Umunna has launched a stinging attack on Boris Johnson who he says is unfit to be Prime Minister, accusing him of having said and done racist things.', 'In a wide-ranging speech, the Lib Dem foreign affairs spokesman said the PM had chosen to align himself with right wing, authoritarian nationalists on the world stage.', 'Asked if he thought Mr Johnson was racist, Mr Umunna told the PA news agency: I think the things that he has said and done are racist.', 'Only he in his heart knows whether he is a racist.', 'Mr Umunna also attacked the Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn.', He said: And likewise with Jeremy Corbyn, Jeremy Corbyn has done things which, arguably, amount to anti-Jewish racism.', 'And he has allowed anti-Jewish racism to proliferate in the party, the Labour Party, during his leadership.', '2.15pm update: Boris says Welsh farmers want to get Brexit done', 'Boris Johnson has been speaking to farmers at the Royal Welsh Winter Fair in Llanelwedd near Builth Wells, Powys.', 'He said: What a lot of people are saying to me is that they want to get Brexit done. That’s the number one message I’m getting from people.', 'Whether they’ve got cattle or whether they’ve got sheep, they want the freedoms that come with Brexit and we’re going to look after farmers across the country, particularly here in Wales.', '1.02pm update: Welsh first minister backs Remain', 'Welsh Labour leader and first minister Mark Drakeford said he would campaign unapologetically, unreservedly and enthusiastically to remain in second referendum under a Jeremy Corbyn government.', 'He said: Three years on from the 2016 EU referendum we understand so much more about how Wales is uniquely exposed to a hardline Boris Johnson Brexit, about the devastation it would do to our manufacturing industry, about the protections it would shear from working people, about the damage it would do to individuals, business and communities the length and the breadth of Wales.', '12.33pm update: Tories would call for curtailed Queen’s Speech on December 19', 'Boris Johnson would push for a slimmed down Queen’s Speech on Thursday December 19 in a bid to get, his Brexit Bill through Parliament as soon as possible if he is returned to office with a majority.', 'The Government is making preparations for a curtailed process that cuts down on ceremony in case Mr Johnson is the new prime minister and wants to drive ahead with a second reading of the withdrawal agreement bill before the Commons rises for Christmas recess.', 'The gelection is due to happen on 12 December and the results will emerge through the early hours of Friday 13 December.', 'A government spokesman said: The new Parliament will be summoned to meet on Tuesday 17 December, when the business will be the election of the Speaker and the swearing-in of members.', 'Should this Prime Minister return, the state opening of Parliament and the Queen’s Speech will follow on Thursday 19 December.', 'The state opening of Parliament will take place with reduced ceremonial elements, as was the case following the early general election in 2017.', 'This is due both to the early general election and the proximity of the state opening to Christmas.', 'If there is a change of government following the election it is anticipated that the Queen’s Speech would be in January on a more usual timetable but this would be a matter for the incoming administration.', '12.12pm update: Scottish Labour leader says only Corbyn offers Brexit choice', 'Scottish Labour Party leader Richard Leonard said Labour is the only party offering to give the choice back to the people on whether to leave the EU or remain.', 'Mr Leonard said the electorate would be allowed to vote on whether they still want the UK to leave the EU or leave with a deal which would be renegotiated by Jeremy Corbyn.', 'He said: The context of where we are on Brexit is that we've got a Labour party proposing to form a government that would give people back the choice in the cold light of day.', 'In contrast to that, you've got a Tory government led by Boris Johnson which would push through a hard Brexit.', 'You 've got the Liberal Democrats who are saying that they would revoke Article 50 and turn their back on the 52 percent who voted to leave, and you've got the SNP whose position is - surprise, surprise - a second independence referendum.', 'So it's only Labour that's offering the choice back to the people.', ' 11.49 am update: Ummuna says Boris will become Trump 's post-Brexit poodle Boris Johnson will become Donald Trump's poodle if the Tories win the election and take the Britain out of the European Union, according to Labour defector Chuka Umunna.', 'Mr Umunna, who is now the Liberal Democrat spokesman on foreign affairs, said the Prime Minister will become more reliant on the US president if the Conservatives are returned to power next month. ', ' In his speech in Watford, Mr Umunna said: Not only will we cease to be that important bridge between the EU and the US but by withdrawing from the European Union, inevitably Johnson will become more reliant on Trump in the short term if he is re-elected.', 'Johnson is desperate to secure a US trade deal to make up for the damage done to our global standing if Brexit happens. ', 'From my own contacts with the US Government, it is clear a high price will be demanded and close alignment with US rules and regulation demanded - we risk becoming a vassal state of the US if Boris Johnson gets a majority.', 'Leave the EU and the UK under Johnson will become President Trump 's poodle. That is what is at stake at this election.','Mr Umunna said Mr Mr Johnson was following the Trump playbook and had become part of this global network of populist, right wing, authoritarian nationalists.', 'He said: Giving Johnson a majority is to give carte blanche to this type of politics in the UK - something which should worry us all.', '11.33am: Blair predicts no deal Brexit under Boris Johnson', 'Tony Blair said he believed a no deal Brexit was now the probable outcome if Boris Johnson is telling the truth about not being willing to extend the Brexit transition period.', 'The former prime minister also said he did not think Tory Brexiters understood how damaging leaving the EU with our a withdrawal agreement would be.', 'He told an audience in London: Within the Conservative cabinet there are people who are ardent Brexiters.', 'They are perfectly content if Britain goes out without a deal and trades on WTO terms.', 'Now, I think a lot of them have no idea what WTO terms really mean.', 'And, by the way, when you talk to people in the WTO about what it means, you can see - it’s a risk no serious person would take with the country’s economy.', '10.55am update: Pound rises on back of Tory poll boost', 'The pound climbed above 10-day lows against the the dollar today as opinion polls showed the Tories were still runaway favourite to win next month’s general election with a pledge to implement Brexit.', 'The currency went up 0.4 percet to $1.2883, rising from Friday’s slump when dire PMI data highlighted the weak state of the UK economy and underscored the low possibility of interest rate hikes in the near future.', 'The pound also rose against the euro, adding 0.4 percent at 85.54 pence.', 'Bookies have lengthened the odds of a hung parliament after the UK election, with the Tories now seen on track for majority of almost 50 MPs.', '10.29am update: France could block Brexit trade deal', 'France could block a post-Brexit trade agreement unless Boris Johnson signs up to stringent EU labour and environmental standards, a trade minister has warned.', 'Jean-Baptise Lemoyne insisted any future trading relationship must remain very close because of the UK and EU’s geographical and historical ties.', 'He said the deal was unlikely to resemble any other bilateral agreement, any other trade agreement that Brussels has previously brokered.', 'Paris will demand that regulatory fair play and a level playing field will be at the head of our demands for the future relationship.', 'He said: We have a mutual interest to preserve this flow of goods and to avoid dumping.', 'Under the terms of the political declaration on the future relationship, Britain and Brussels have committed to reaching an agreement with tariff-free and quota-free access for goods and market access for the services industry.', 'EU Brexit supremo Michel Barnier has declared there can also be no dumping – where products are made cheap by unfair competition.', '10.03am update: Nicky Morgan insists January trade deal absolutely possible', 'Outgoing Culture Secretary Nicky Morgan has insisted securing a trade deal by January is absolutely possible and confirmed the deadline was the first big step towards getting Brexit done.', 'Ms Morgan backed the Conservative manifesto's promise that the UK will leave the EU on January 31 saying getting that trade agreement at a stage it can be put to Parliament is absolutely possible.', 'She said that there was an awful lot of thinking and discussions already going on as she added the trade experts she speaks with say it is eminently possible that Brexit can be achieved by the end of January.', 'She said: People recognise there are other phases but overall in terms of the amount of airtime, emotion and everything else, that will be such a big step.', 'The EU want that to happen, they clearly want to move on, they 've got a new commission, they will want to work on their priorities too.', '9.32am update: Blair repeats call for Brexit to be scrapped', 'Tony Blair has repeated his calls for Brexit to be reversed.', 'The former prime minister used a speech in London to argue for a second referendum on the decision to leave and said such a vote would have to be followed by another general election.', 'Mr Blair said Britain was in a mess with neither Labour nor Boris Johnson’s Tories deserving to win next month’s election.', 'He told a Reuters event: We're a mess.The buoyancy of the world economy has kept us going up to now but should that falter, we will be in deep trouble.', 'He said the December 12 vote offered a stark choice between a socialist-run state under Labour, which is offering a second referendum on leaving the EU, and the Conservatives who want to get Brexit done by the end of January.', 'He said Mr Corbyn was promising a revolution but warned: The problem with revolutions is never how they begin but how they end.', 'The truth is: the public aren't convinced either main party deserves to win this election outright.', '9.07 am update: Farage says Tory manifesto is a copy of UKIP 's 2015 pledge', 'Nigel Farage has described Boris Johnson’s Tory election manifesto as a copy of the UKIP document he drafted in 2015.', 'Mr Johnson is already facing scrutiny after his election promises were called into question by Labour and fact-checkers. And now Mr Farage has claimed much of the Tory manifesto bears an uncanny resemblance to the pledges he made four years ago.', 'The Brexit Party leader said: I recognise much of the Conservative manifesto because they’re things that I have campaigned on for years, such as hospital parking charges.', 'Much of the manifesto was in fact in the UKIP 2015 manifesto, even recent ideas that I’ve announced like not exporting plastic waste for dumping in landfill in China or elsewhere, that’s in there.', 'So, I’m pleased that they are changing the agenda. They’re even talking, maybe, about reducing immigration levels and of course Brexit.', 'So, I do feel that I recognise a lot of it. My question is, do they mean it and are they going to deliver?', 'Mr Farage also said he is concerned that Boris Johnson’s plan to bring the Withdrawal Agreement back before Christmas could lead to Brexit in name only.', 'He said: I want to get Brexit done, as does the country. Not just Brexit voters but now a large chunk of Remain voters just want this over and done with.', 'Getting it over and done with is one thing, getting it over and done with properly is quite another, and that is as I see it now the role of the Brexit Party - to get Brexit done properly.', '8.29am update: Merkel clashes with Macron as EU tensions rise', 'Angela Merkel has launched at furious attack against Emmanuel Macron, saying she is tired of picking up the pieces as tensions between the EU figureheads edge closer to breaking point.', 'The German Chancellor told her French counterpart: I understand your desire for disruptive politics, but I’m tired of picking up the pieces.', 'Over and over, I have to glue together the cups you have broken so that we can then sit down and have a cup of tea together.', 'Earlier this month, the French President launched another broadside towards his global allies, warning a lack of leadership is causing the brain death of the NATO military alliance, questioning whether its commitment to collective defence still existed.', '8.02am update: Sir John Curtice warns of more Brexit delays under hung Parliament', 'Political scientist Sir John Curtice said voters face a clear binary choice in the 2019 general election, warning the UK will undoubtedly head towards an extension if there is a hung parliament.', 'He said: This is pretty much a binary election.', 'Hung parliament, then we’re almost undoubtedly heading towards an extension and a second referendum, and lord knows what the outcome of that will be.', 'Or we get a majority and we go out on January 31 and Boris is charged with the task of negotiating an alternative outcome.', 'Ironically at the end of the day we’ve kind of stumbled into this election, but as the way it’s turning out, it’s actually providing us with a fairly clear binary choice.', 'At least so far as the implications of the various outcomes concerned.', '7.30am update: Author applies for Irish passport', 'The author behind the Jack Reacher thriller series is reportedly applying for an Irish passport due to Brexit.', 'Lee Child, whose real name is James Grant, has sold more than 100 million books.', 'He lives between the UK and the US but is entitled to an Irish passport as his father was born in Belfast.', 'The author said he wants an Irish passport to avoid the possibility of post-Brexit travel restrictions in Europe.', 'He told the Irish Times: I haven’t got the passport yet but I will do very soon, it feels like I’m cheating to be honest as I will get in the back door.'
header.socioLingVar: Nationality - European or anti-Europeans,Nationality - General,Age - Over 65s,Age - Youngsters

commentThread.commentText: "its own laws clearly state every member nation must have a commissioner. But EU legal teams have been working round the clock throughout the weekend to come up with a solution". A whole weekend to nullify one of the key parts of the EU 'constitution'. Ha, ha, ha.

replies.commentText: The EU true to form.

Continue reading the EU legal terms to the articles where you read what happens if one of the members breaches the terms article 4 and make sure to also read article 246 that a vacant seat on the Commission can remain vacant under certain conditions.

I'm all for your Brexit but why should 27 nations wait for you for THREE years. Even the British parliament, a key part of UK governance had to have decisions made for it by the unelected UK supreme court Ha, ha, ha.

The EU didn't have to wait. They could have refused an extension. The UK Supreme, AKA the EU show court set up by Blair will be scrapped after the GE. As for the THREE years.The referendum vote by constituencies was 406 Leave to 242 Remain. Many of the 406 mp 's lied to their constituents to get elected when they promised to deliver Brexit then did everything they could to stop it. This is how parliament ended up being very clearly undemocratic and seen as parliament V the people, and rightly so. But please be patient a little longer. There will soon be a working majority in government that will deliver Brexit.

I agree, 27 nation's shouldn't wait for us, except for of course the longer it takes, the more we pay. Believe me the British people are desperate to put that vindictive den of thieves behind them and to move on as soon as possible.

You don't pay a single penny more. The UK signed the MFF 2014-2020 which is a legally binding contract. Consequently and in application of international treaty law Vienna Convention on the law of treaties, article 70b you have to honour this contract. Meaning your budget payments continue until December 2020 regardless of when you leave.
Its the EU way stick to the rules regardless ! That is until it affects how things are done!

Actually, it doesn't even bother doing that. As long ago as 2003, the European Court of Justice ruled that EU finance ministers were negligent in allowing France and Germany to continually ignore eurozone GDP deficit rules. Nothing happened. France then breached the 3% rule every year from 2008 to 2017. It scraped under at 2.9% last year, but Macron’s capitulation to the gilets jaunes makes it certain that France will break the the rule again next year. France has never been sanctioned nor has Germany. As the FT’s political editor wrote at the time: "France and Germany won. The message was clear: the European Union has rules, but not everyone has to obey them."

Oh yeah? What’s more, they were supported in this action by the UK otherwise known as the country that like to lecture others on fiscal discipline. Gordon Brown was chancellor at the time. So whatever point you're trying to make that took place over 15 years ago in the light of our decision to pursue a ridiculously damaging brexit, and smear the EU, ECJ of dishonesty, it had our uk's full compliance and support right? What matter most is what is happening now, now in 2019, and what safeguards are now in place since that time, which has nothing to do with brexit and should never had influenced your thinking into supporting a leave campaign sold to our uk on a damaging false prospectus. I mean no disrespect but you should have been far more objective instead of subjective in your thinking and research of those events and should have treated them as a separate matter not meriting an abrupt over reactive response in abdicating our european seat and position, throwing our membership in the face of the EU27. So what else have you got to tell everyone here about something happening over a decade & a half ago man?
That's why member states have 2nd and subsequent Referenda on the same issue until the required result is achieved.
Such as? the EU does not have any say in referendums which are a purely national competence.
hahahahha

commentThread.commentText: But EU legal teams have been working round the clock throughout the weekend to come up with a solution to make the new Commission legitimate without a British presence.........................A K A moving the goalposts. Typical Commie/Socialist exercise to make sure they get the desired result.

replies.commentText: Stop whingeing. It's what you wanted. Grow some
Eiserne  front.....Ah! I see where you are coming from, politically speaking
(null)
The EU did not change a single rule. The UK on the other hand broke several rules.

commentThread.commentText: I’m glad we’ve not submitted a Commissioner as it demonstrates we are committed to leaving but doesn’t it just show you easy the EU can change their own rules.  Sooner out the better.

replies.commentText: They circumvented many of the Maastricht Treaty "opt-outs" the UK had negotiated .... Do we need another lesson ?
How?

The EU hasn't changed a single rule. The Lisbon treaty agreed by the governments of all member states, each and without exception backed by a majority in their national parliaments contains an infringement procedure the EU commission that is Guardian of the Treaties must initiate in such instances, and that is exactly what the EU commission has done. See Lisbon Article 258, ex 226 TEC: "If the Commission considers that a Member State has failed to fulfil an obligation under the Treaties, it shall deliver a reasoned opinion on the matter after giving the State concerned the opportunity to submit its observations. If the State concerned does not comply with the opinion within the period laid down by the Commission, the latter may bring the matter before the Court of Justice of the European Union."
(null)

I suggest you stop your blame shifting and read up on EU law. For a start, it is the UK, not the EU that is breaking the rules by not nominating a Candidate Commissioner and by breaking the terms of a contract with the EU27. At the moment the UK is in breach of is duty of sincere cooperation and of the prohibition of hindering the functioning of the EU Lisbon article 4 and is violating the extension agreement of 29 October 2019. The outgoing Juncker Commission applies EU law and consequently launched the infringement procedure that may lead to fines for the UK Lisbon Article 258, ex 226 TEC as national government cannot become an obstacle for the functioning of the EU. You seem to think it is unlawful for the EU Commission to convene without a Commissioner from the EU.It isn 't. The Lisbon Treaty article Article 246 permits to maintain a posts vacant if a Commissioner leaves before the end of the mandate by resignation, compulsory retirement or death I suggest you also read article 17 5 and 7 So, tell us: which law is the EU breaking ?
I can tell you’re an EU fanatic.  Hide fact in a thousand words when a dozen would do.
And your reply to the substance and content is?
Is it substance and content or merely repackaged EU noise?  The EU have a track record of changing, sorry reinterpreting the rules.
Me too,  but just think what damage one could have done vetoing everything they tried to do.
This should tell remainers something about EU "principles", but probably wont.

Such as? Because not a single rule has been changed. It's the UK that broke the rules which should tell the world something about the UK although it would not be anything the world does not already known.

commentThread.commentText: blockquote class="spcv_blockquote">"The author said he wants an Irish passport to avoid the possibility of post-Brexit travel restrictions in Europe."/blockquote>There you have the only reason why someone would be a REmoaner. Because they only care about what they can personally get or lose. They abuse positions of power and have no morals or honour.

replies.commentText: "...what they can personally get or lose" What a ludicrous comment!!!!! Totally applies to Brexiteer's as well. How could it not?
You are just jealous that you will be stuck on your foggy damp little island.

I'd be happy to get an Indian passport, as long as I could also keep my UK one. Why not?  There are a few countries where it would be easier to use the Indian passport. I wouldn't SWAP them of course.
There is nowhere more foggy and damp than Ireland.

No problem give him an Irish passport in EXCHANGE for his UK one. Suddenly the barriers to him travelling throughout Europe will DISAPPEAR.Just like they were BEFORE we were FORCED into the EU in the first place. How old is this guy TEN?.
But that would upset the DUP! They’ ve told their unionist supporters to get Irish passports. Seriously, Paisley Jnr in particular, look it up.

commentThread.commentText: If James Grant; an author I've never heard of wants an Irish passport, then fine, Just as long as he turns in his British passport when he get's it. Then stays in the EU.

replies.commentText: James doesn't need to hand his British passport in. We allow dual nationality. Why would you want to take away his rights? Spite, or jealousy?

How about no dual nationality. Either you are British or just a non-voting resident. How can one have a shared allegiance to more than one country? My wife is Japanese, and once our children reached their early twenties they had to decide on either a British or Japanese passport. My wife will always be Japanese.

My wife is Chinese when she came to the UK and took British passport she had to give up her Chinese passport. We have subsequently returned to China but she cant get her Chinese passport back so we have had to apply for a residency passport
Because we are moving beyond these simple concepts. I am very happy to hold dual nationality and feel equally at home in either country.
His pseudonym is Lee Childs who write the Jack Reacher Series. I think he must have wrote over 20 books in the series.
true and good books as well
Thanks, never knew that.

Because of rules defined by the Irish government many, many decades ago any  foreign national that has an Irish parent or grandparent can claim an Irish passport. Because millions of Irishmen travelled to the UK, the US and former colonies seeking work and a new start in life there could be more Irish passport holders outside the ROI than there is currently in the ROI.
There are probably more people entitled to an Irish Passport than there are people living in entire UK.
The Irish only left Ireland so they would have somewhere to sing about going back to.
There are probably more people around the world singing songs about being Irish than have ever lived in Ireland, or even know where it is on a map.
And, of course you can back up that outlandish claim...... No, I thought not. What a real bore you are.

But, under the CTA agreement he will be able to come and go as he pleases.   We need to revoke the CTA ASAP, and all/any UN treaties that prevent us from immediately deporting illegals and foreign criminals as we see fit.

I did notice that one judge whilst REJECTING a deportation of an EU criminal actually said "what is the point when they can come straight back in". Hopefully NOT after our FREEDOM from the EU but THAT could take DECADES under the Boris / May surrender treaty.They are virtually the same anyway apart from the irish border in the Irish Sea as CONFIRMED last week by an EU spokeswoman.
In 2017 the UK deported 5,301 EU citizens.

commentThread.commentText: So they can break their OWN laws...no problem?

replies.commentText: Which one?
They have convened without all member reps being allotted......
Seems so.......

commentThread.commentText: Leave could win another referendum... with a greater majority! Thats why they dont want one!

replies.commentText: There would not be a choice to just leave in another referendum. it would be either leave with a deal, or remain in the EU. A poor choice!
No, we don't want one because it yet again delays leaving.
(null)

The fact is that you lost the first one. Until the result of the referendum is delivered in full, then the referendum result is not fully discharged. Having a 2n d referendum before the first is delivered, is anti democratic. What would you do if you lost the 2n d Referendum, but by a bigger margin?. Remember you lost the first one 63 % to 37 % in the constituency, and its now the constituency 's that will decide the Election.
unless of course the remainers bump off another of their own to get a sympathy vote!

commentThread.commentText: Thats right get your passport and get in line with the other illegal immigrants
No UK commissioner on the EU Council, ECJ is going to be busy sorting that out, no doubt it will be fiddled to suit the EU. No Commissioner no membership out with no deal

replies.commentText: There aren't any Commissioners on the EU council. the EU council consists of the Prime Ministers/Presidents of the member states.

replies.commentText: There is no such rule. The rules are that if a member state does not nominate a Commissioner, the Commission must launch an infringement procedure against that member state  Lisbon treaty article 258 Which is exactly what the Commission did. Meanwhile the Commission can convene with a vacant seat Lisbon Treaty article 246 for which the procedure is laid out in 175 and 7.

commentThread.commentText: lets make it easy shall we in reply to bliar , if WTO is so bad then why does it excist , even the EU  trade under wto rules .

replies.commentText: This is how international trade works: - WTO - schedules By default goods are subjected to tariffs, quotas and customs controls, that 's WTO schedules. Doesn't cover complex services. - FTA Free Trade Agreement if you want to lift or reduce tariffs and quotas, you have to set up a regulatory level playing field with equivalence rules don 't have to be exactly the same but must have the same outcome. That's a FTA.Does not cover complex services and still requires customs controls.- Customs Union Trade Agreement if you want to also lift custom controls, you have to enhance your FTA with a common external trade policy.That 's called a customs union trade agreement. - Single Market Trade Agreement if you want to freely circulate all four factors of economy goods, services, capital, labour you all have to play by the same rules because services etc are not hindered by tariffs but by differences in regulations.Such a full alignment is required to set up a single market.That 's why there are so many rules: to sustain the free circulation of all four factors of economy. Example When you want to do a FTA with the US, you will have to level with the US rule book to set up a level playing field with the US so that WTO schedules can be lifted. The EU has the following trade deals with non - EU states: -287 bilateral, sectorial and multilateral trade deals - 72 FTAs - 3 customs union trade deals - 4 SM participation trade deals
Not a single country trades solely on WTO schedules - they all try to trade on WTO schedules as little as possible.

Does that mean that anything the new EU commission does is now illegal and can be challenged in the ECJ,

replies.commentText: No it doesn't. An incomplete Commission is not per definition unlawful.The Lisbon Treaty for instance permits to maintain a posts vacant if a Commissioner leaves before the end of the mandate. At the moment the UK is in breach of is duty of sincere cooperation and of hte prohibition of hindering the functioning of the EU.The outgoing Juncker Commission therefore launched the infringement procedure that may lead to fines for the UK. The national governments of all 27 EU member states agreed that the new commission can start, as soon as it wins a vote of confidence in the EU parliamen article 17.5 and 17.7 while article 246 says that a Commission post can remain vacant for a short period under certain conditions. Anyone can indeed challenge the Commission 's decision at the ECJ but everybody is fully confident that the case for starting the Commission with 27 members is legally sound.
The ECJ is not autonomous  and is controlled by the dictate from Brussels.
Then why has it repeatedly ruled against the Commission?
